lines.text: Well, what are you doing down here?
Thought it might rain, so, I brought your rubbers.
This runnin' a boardin' house for Freaks, ain't what it used to be.
Well - why not?
Everything goin' out and nothing comin' in.
Well, Thelma, I guess we can go home now. Nothing more we can do.
No, I guess there ain't anything else that can happen.
[In walks a gorilla]
But, we're still pals, aren't we, Pittsy?
Ah, sure!
Then, shake.
Say, is the first edition out yet?
Lamp it back there.
[Reporter picks up the newspaper]

Oh, baby! Right, smack dab on the front page again! Look! There's my story. That's the third time I've crashed the front page this week! When you can write stuff like that, you won't be playing "Home, Sweet Home" on your typewriter. Give that the double-O, dearie!
[Reporter exits]
My, she likes you a whole lot, don't she?
Oh, will you stop your moaning and look at the bright side of things!
Yeah, on a night like this?
Come on!
Oh, goodbye world!
